content: Having just been exposed (by @Virginia Lorenzi @Lisa Nelson @Debi Willis et al) to my first run-through of how HL7 WGs work, with the frenetic interconnections between WGs etc, I can't escape concluding that HL7 is in fact a gigantic beehive, including countless significant signaling dances that convey immensely important information in each split second of contact.
We continue to work on how to scale to include more bees and make the signalling devices easier to learn and more efficient
It's been a open source software analogy for a long time: https://wiki.pentaho.com/display/BEEKEEPER/The+Beekeeper :) (I used to work at an OSS services company called The Hyve) :bee:
The analogy makes sense, but in DECADES of software-related work I've never seen anything like this. (OTOH I've never gotten embedded in an open source project before.)
I'm beginning to really like you, @Dave deBronkart :joy:
